result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J. Meeler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation on Ct 2 in this same case as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant needs to find his own Community Service with the approval of his agent.
AMENDED 08/02/2017  The defendant needs to finish 60 hours of Community Service by 09/20/2017, if cannot finish the Community Service he has two options:.  
1.  He needs to get a letter from a doctor stating that he will be able to complete Community Services in the future (within 6 months), then he can request a hearing and have the Probation extended.
2.  If he cannot finish the Community Service or get a letter he would then need to report to the Clark County Jail on 09/20/2017 by 7:00 pm for 7 and 1/2 days.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Probation on Ct 1 in this same case.

miscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Timothy J. Meeler appeared, pro se.    Defendant did not complete Community Service - Jail to start 09/20/2017, at 7:00 pm, unless he has community service done or if can get a letter from a doctor that he can do community services in the future, (6 months) he can request a hearing and see if probation can be extended

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Timothy J. Meeler, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.

Pre-trial conference at 03-15-2016 10:00 am.
Status conference at 04-07-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.    Defendant must contact the Clark County Sheriff's Department within 48 hours to schedule and complete at the date and time designated by the Sheriff's Department, the booking process, which includes fingerprinting and photos.

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Timothy J. Meeler, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  The defense waived reading of the complaint and stood mute to the charges.  BASED ON THE DEFENDANT STANDING MUTE,THE COURT ENTERED A NOT GUILTY PLEA ON BEHALF OF THE DEFENDANT  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
